resources.string: Connect internet via Reverse WiFi/USB Tethering. With this, your mobile device can share your PC\'s (wired) network and access to internet via Wireless LAN or USB cable. \nIs it MOBILE? anyway I need it.

Usage: 
	0. enable WiFi/USB tether of your device. 
	1. enter IP address of WiFi/USB interface of PC. 
	 (Dynamic by default.) 
	2. enter DNS address. 
	 (default is last DNS using by device.) 

on PC side: 
	1. connect to device's WiFi/USB tether. (Dynamic) 
	2. enable internet share. 
	 (on linux, enable IP Forward and Masquerade.) 
	 $ echo 1 |sudo tee /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward 
	 $ sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE 

Known Problems: 
	* cannot connect to gtalk service. 
	* cannot download apps from market. 
	 (but market searching is working.) 
	* can i determind peer address automatically?
